G4109-d-04-27-97-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
G4109-d-04-27-97-WC.Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
G4109-d-04-27-97-WC.Narrative: THE 1600 SWITCH CREW WAS PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES IN THE STEVENS POINT YARD.  IN THE COURSE OF THEIR DUTIES, THEY WERE DOUBLING 33 CARS TO MAKE UP TRAIN #11 ON TRACK #3.  THEY HAD A HOLD OF 31 LOADS AND 52 EMPTIES WHEN THEY STRETCHED THE TRACK AFTER MAKING THE JOINT.  ONE MAN WAS ON THE GROUND ATTHE JOINT AND ANOTHER WAS AT THE EAST END OF THE SHOVE.  THE ENGINEER STARTED TO SHOVE THE TRACK ONCE HE RECEIVED CONFIRMATION THAT THE TRACK WAS TOGETHER.  HE HAD SHOVED APPROXIMATELY 12 TO 15 CAR LENGTHS WHEN ONE OF HIS CREW MEMBERS STOPPED THE MOVEMENT UPON HEARING CARS DERAIL.  INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED BETWEEN TWO FLAT CARS ACCOUNT INTERACTION OF LATERAL-VERTICAL FORCES.  THESE CARS THEN SEPARATED CAUSING ONE OF THE CARS TO HIT AND DAMAGE AN ENGINE SITTING ON THENEXT TRACK.  THE ENGINE SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO ITS FUEL TANK CAUSING AN APPROXIMATE LOSS OF 400 GALLONS. OF FUEL.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

G4108-d-04-26-97-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
G4108-d-04-26-97-WC.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
G4108-d-04-26-97-WC.Narrative: INVESTIGATION OF THIS INCIDENT REVEALED THAT TRAIN L017, CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES, 25 LOADS AND 23 EMPTIES WAS SIDESWIPED WHILE PULLING OUT OF THE STEVENS POINT YARD.  THE INCIDENT OCCURRED SOMETIME DURING THE HOURS OF 7:00 PM AND 11:00 PM (THE TIME THE CREW REPORTED FOR DUTY AND WHEN THEY FOUNDTHE DAMAGED CARS).  IT APPEARS THAT AN UNKNOWN SWITCH CREW HAD SHOVED TRACK 5 INTO L017 WHEN THEY DEPARTED STEVENS POINT.  NEITHER CREW WAS AWARE OF THE DAMAGE AT THE TIME OF IMPACT.  L017 BECAME AWARE OF THE DAMAGED CARS WHILE SETTING OUT CARS AT ROTHSCHILD AT 11:00 PM.  THE RESPONSIBLE SWITCH CREWFAILED TO HAVE A PERSON AT THE LEADING END OF THEIR MOVEMENT CAUSING THEM TO SHOVE INTO THE DEPARTING TRAIN.  SINCE THIS CREW CANNOT BE IDENTIFIED, IT IS IMPOSSIBLE TO PROVIDE ANY ACTUAL INFORMATIONON THE TRAIN ON TRACK 5 OR THE EXACT TIME THE INCIDENT TOOK PLACE.  THE REAR CAR ON TRACK 5 HAD SUSTAINED MINOR SIDESWIPE DAMAGE.  NO PARTY HAS BEEN NAMED RESPONSIBLE IN THIS INCIDENT BY THE MANAGEMENT ON THE WESTERN DIVISION DUE TO THE UNKNOWN FACTORS.NoneNoneNoneNone

G97508-d-04-16-97-GWWR.Primary Accident Cause: Hazardous materials regulations, failure to comply
G97508-d-04-16-97-GWWR.Accident Cause: Hazardous materials regulations, failure to comply
G97508-d-04-16-97-GWWR.Narrative: ON APRIL 16, 1997 THE GATEWAY WESTERN YARD JOB Y-113 WENT ON DUTY AT 3:00 PM IN EAST ST. LOUIS, ILLINOIS.  THEY WERE INSTRUCTED TO SWITCH CARS FROM TRACKS IN A YARD AND PUT TOGETHER A BLOCK OF CARS FOR DELIVERY TO ETHYL CORPORATION IN SAUGET, ILLINOIS.  THEY WERE SHOVING #9 TRACK IN A YARD WHEN THECREW NOTICED A LIQUID LEAKING FROM A TANK CAR ABOUT FIFTEEN CARS DEEP IN THE TRACK.  THE CREW ADVISED THE SUPERVISOR OF OPERATIONS OF THE DERAILMENT AND THE RELEASE OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS.  A FORMAL INVESTIGATION ON THE CREW DETERMINED THAT CARS WERE CUT-OFF IN MOTION AND CARS WERE ALLOWED TO ROLL AGAINST CARS CONTAINING HAZARDOUS MATERIALS, WHICH RESULTED IN THE DERAILMENT OF UTLX 125108 UPON IMPACT WITH GATX 66340.  IT WAS ALSO DETERMINED THAT WHEN THE CREW SHOVED NUMBER 9 TRACK, THE TRUCKS ONTHE B-END OF UTLX 125108 WERE DISPLACED AND WERE ABOUT THE CENTER OF THE CAR CAUSING THE B-END TO RAISE ABOVE THE COUPLER ON GATX 66340 RESULTING IN A PUNCTURE OF SAME. GATX 66340 LEAKED 1,8184NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

972-d-04-05-97-HRRC.Narrative: RBOX 34057 WAS THE 15TH CAR IN CONSIST AND 1ST TO DERAIL.  POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS APPROXIMATELY 75FEET NORTH OF CROSSING.  OF THE FIVE CARS TO DERAIL, TWO PASSED OVER THE CROSSING, ONE CAME TO RESTON THE CROSSING AND TWO NORTH OF THE CROSSING.  ALL CARS REMAINED UPRIGHT.  INSPECTION OF DERAILED RBOX 34057 REVEALED UNUSUAL WHEEL WEAR, WITH VERY SHARP VERTICAL FLANGE ON LEADING AXLE OF LEADING TRUCK.  WHEEL REPORT IS ATTACHED.  CONDITION MAY HAVE CAUSED FAILURE OF TRUCK TO SWIVEL, CREATING EXCESSIVE LATERAL FORCE ON THE HIGH RAIL.  CENTER CASTING TO BE INSPECTED AT TIME OF CAR REPAIR.  IN ADDITION, THERE WAS SUBSTANTIAL PRECIPITATION PRIOR TO THIS ACCIDENT.  THE SUBGRADE MAY HAVE BECOME SATURATED, LEADING TO SOME INSTABILITIY OF THE TRACK STRUCTURE.  THIS WAS A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR IN THISACCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

970410-d-04-30-97-DH.Accident Cause: Deviation from uniform top of rail profile
970410-d-04-30-97-DH.Narrative: TRAIN 390 HAD AN APPROACH TO CP 0-1, WAS APPROACHING CP0.1 PREPARED TO STOP.  GOT A RESTRICTING SIGNAL AT CP0-1.  RELEASED THE AUTOMATIC BRAKE AND GRADUALLY OPENED THE THROTTLE TO THE 4TH POSITION.  GOT KNUCKLE ON CAR UMP 46900 12 DEEP FROM HEAD END (30% OLD BRAKE).  PUT TRAIN BACK TOGETHER AND WHENAIR REACHED 76 LBS ON EOT PULLED UP APPROXIMATELY 1,500 FT. TO THE #8 SWITCH AND STOPPED ACCOUNT SWITCH LINED AGAINST THEM.  AFTER SWITCHES WERE LINED ATTEMPTED TO PULL TRAIN BUT COULD NOT GET TRAINSTARTED.  CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND CUT 33 HEAD CARS OFF TO CLEAR GREEN STREET AND DELIVERED TO #1 IN THE PORT OF ALBANY.  PROCEEDED WTIH LIGHT POWER BACK TO THE TRAIN AND TRIED TO MAKE A PULL ON THEBALANCE OF THE TRAIN BUT COULD NOT GET STARTED.  CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND THE 46TH THROUGH 52ND HEAD CAR DERAILED.  CONDUCTOR THEN NOTIFIED THE DISPATCHER OF THE DERAILMENT.  CAUSE:  WHEEL CLIMB OF TLCX 35106 R4/L4 (LEADING WHEEL SET) DUE TO CROSS LEVEL VARIATION IN CONJUNCTION WITH UNIFORM PROFILE DEVIATION AND SLIGHT MISALIGNMENT.  (SPEED RANGE WITHIN THE CRITICAL HARMONIC ROLL AT 15.4 MPH).NoneNoneNone
